item.title: Why income share agreements did not work out
item.description:
Sean Linehan on Twitter

“I launched an Income Share Agreement (ISA) company in 2019. Our company survived, but our use of ISAs did not. Overall, I think the ISA experiment has failed and is not the revolution we hoped would transform training and education. Here’s what I learned 👇”

URL: https://twitter.com/seanlinehan/status/1505923007096700939

item.title: Why we have 0.05
item.description:
Daniël Lakens on Twitter

“I know I will not be able do much against viral incorrect tweets, but let’s try. No, we do not have 0.05 because of book sales. Fisher, 1926, did not pick any specific threshold. This paper https://t.co/is0IzNchht suggests SPSS (default of 0.05) did a lot to spread 0.05. https://t.co/zsoFmoLEz7”

URL: https://mobile.twitter.com/lakens/status/1503456387216687104?cxt=HHwWgIC-9crnrN0pAAAA

item.title: Lessons From Keynes For The Crisis In Ukraine
item.description:
I gave a talk at an IMF event on Tuesday alongside Douglas Holtz-Eakin and Francesco Saraceno. On the off-chance that some of the subscribers to this newsletter were unable to make the event, I’m posting my prepared remarks here. The IMF folks had asked for some historical insights from Keynes regarding policy options in a post-COVID world, but…

URL: https://zacharydcarter.substack.com/p/lessons-from-keynes-for-the-crisis?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: A Flaw in My Plan to Get & Stay in the Work Zone Before Lunch, &
